wikipedia_page.main: John Cyril Stacey (7 November 1895 – 17 September 1964) was an English professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1910s and 1920s. He played at representative level for Great Britain and Yorkshire, and at club level for Halifax (Heritage № 245) and Batley as a fullback. He is a Halifax Hall Of Fame Inductee.
